intro: Valeriana elatior, commonly known as greater valerian, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, clustered flowers and dense, dark green foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters, with opposite leaves and small, tubular flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Valeriana elatior is also valued for its medicinal properties, traditionally used to treat anxiety and sleep disorders.
